name.description: The name of the queue. Queue names must be made up of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens, and must be between 1 and 80 characters long. For a FIFO (first-in-first-out) queue, the name must end with the .fifo suffix.

visibility_timeout_seconds.description: The visibility timeout for the queue. An integer from 0 to 43200 (12 hours).

message_retention_seconds.description: The number of seconds Amazon SQS retains a message. Integer representing seconds, from 60 (1 minute) to 1209600 (14 days).

max_message_size.description: The limit of how many bytes a message can contain before Amazon SQS rejects it. An integer from 1024 bytes (1 KiB) up to 262144 bytes (256 KiB).

delay_seconds.description: The time in seconds that the delivery of all messages in the queue will be delayed. An integer from 0 to 900 (15 minutes)

receive_wait_time_seconds.description: The time for which a ReceiveMessage call will wait for a message to arrive (long polling) before returning. An integer from 0 to 20 (seconds).

fifo_queue.description: Boolean designating a FIFO queue. If not set, it defaults to false making it standard.

content_based_deduplication.description: Enables content-based deduplication for FIFO queues.

kms_master_key_id.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.

kms_data_key_reuse_period_seconds.description: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86400 seconds (24 hours).

deduplication_scope.description: Specifies whether message deduplication occurs at the message group or queue level.

fifo_throughput_limit.description: Specifies whether the FIFO queue throughput quota applies to the entire queue or per message group.

tags.description: The list of tags to apply to the queue.
